newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's Forum says no stake in steel firm.
newsitem.headline: Manila's Forum says no stake in steel firm.

text.p: Forum Pacific Inc said on Wednesday it would not pursue its intended purchase of shares in National Steel Corp (NSC) in view of the recent acquisition of a majority stake in the firm by a foreign investor.
In November last year, Forum said it would buy 15.75 million shares, or about three to five percent, of NSC for about 204.75 million pesos from Wing Tiek Holdings Bhd.

Early this week, however, NSC announced that Hottick Investments Ltd had acquired 82.5 percent of NSC with the payment of $800 million to Wing Tiek. Hottick is a Hong Kong-based trust and investment company owned by Malaysian businessmen and Hong Kong investors.
The formerly state-owned NSC was acquired by Wing Tiek last year.
NSC is the country's largest producer of flat long steel products.
